_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm with auto. shutoff at 85%, min. Class I Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class I Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class I Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Thermal activated (<250oF) and hydrocarbon detector auto shutdown
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure, & liquid level indicators/transmitters
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane [(3 x 60,000) gallons plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure] blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations occur primarily during the "cold" season.  Prevention program administered through 14 elements of facility PSM program.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC

Knoxville West Terminal



RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC - Knoxville West Terminal in Knoxville, TN is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the Knoxville West Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Knoxville West Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community in which it operates. PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC - Knoxville West Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Knoxville, Tennessee. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low-diesel fuel, and additives.  The Knoxville West Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses the Butane unloading sta

tion, Butane storage vessel, valves, pump and associated piping. Butane is stored in one vessel and transferred to/blended with gasoline (product rack injection) through the use of a fixed piping system and injection skid.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Knoxville West Terminal:

1) Employee Participation,

2) Process Safety Information,

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),

4) Standard Operating Procedures,

5) Operator Training,

6) Contractors,

7) Pre-startup Safety Review,

8) Mechanical Integrity,

9) Hazardous Work Authorization (Hot Work, etc.),

10) Management of Change,

11) Incident Investigation,

12) Emergency Procedures/Planning,

13) Compliance Audits, and

14) Trade Secrets.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Knoxville West Terminal Facility Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC is continually striving to make the Knoxville West Terminal the safest and most reliable w

orkplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Knoxville West Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in its health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, PBF Logistics Products Terminals, LLC will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Knoxville West Terminal and surrounding community.
